<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 10+"
    pfs=""
>
[Exploration Lens](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1443)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Strength of Thousands</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #171: Hurricane's Howl](/Sources.aspx?ID=101) pg. 76</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

</row>

<row gap="medium">
<row gap="tiny"><row>**Activate**</row><actions string="Single Action" /><row>Interact</row></row>

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

An _exploration lens_ is a magical glass lens designed for a [bull's-eye lantern](/Equipment.aspx?ID=29). When light from the lantern passes through the lens, it alters the light to make it easier to perform a common exploration activity with the lantern. You can find more information about exploration activities related to these lenses on page 496 of the Core Rulebook. Alternatively, an _exploration lens_ can be installed in a [_wayfinder_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=470) like an [_aeon stone_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=407). In this case, light (such as that from a lantern, [torch](/Equipment.aspx?ID=60), or [_light_](/Spells.aspx?ID=171) spell) must still pass through the lens and you must hold the _wayfinder_ in your hand for it to function.

 There are several different types of exploration lens, each granting benefits with a different type of exploration activity. Each type of lens is distinguishable from all the other types by holding it up to a bright light.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

<title
level="2"
right="Item 10"
pfs="Limited"
>
Exploration Lens (Detecting)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #171: Hurricane's Howl](/Sources.aspx?ID=101) pg. 76</row>

**Price** 1,000 gp

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

When held up to light, this lens sparkles as though infused with glitter. While [Detecting Magic](/Actions.aspx?ID=513) in exploration mode, when the lantern's light falls upon something you detect as magical, it pulsates faintly. This makes it easier to triangulate the magic, since you can use the cone of the bull's-eye lantern instead of the circular pulse of [_detect magic_](/Spells.aspx?ID=66). You also gain a +2 item bonus to checks to [Identify Magic](/Actions.aspx?ID=24) within the light.

<title
level="2"
right="Item 12"
pfs="Limited"
>
Exploration Lens (Investigating)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #171: Hurricane's Howl](/Sources.aspx?ID=101) pg. 76</row>

**Price** 1,750 gp

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

The outer rim of this lens glows faintly when held up to the light. While activated, the lens grants you a +1 item bonus to skill checks to [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26) while [Investigating](/Actions.aspx?ID=516) by outlining potential clues in a way that triggers your memory. If you're Investigating something while using the lens, you can always roll a Recall Knowledge skill check appropriate to the investigation for initiative.

<title
level="2"
right="Item 14"
pfs="Limited"
>
Exploration Lens (Searching)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #171: Hurricane's Howl](/Sources.aspx?ID=101) pg. 76</row>

**Price** 4,000 gp

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

This lens has an opalescent sheen when held up to light. The lens subtly outlines hidden doors and concealed hazards, granting you a +2 item bonus to Perception checks to spot such features while [Searching](/Actions.aspx?ID=519). Even if you aren't Searching, you get a check to find [traps](/Traits.aspx?ID=158) that normally require you to Search.
name: Exploration Lens
